meanings.sent1: Being the primus student in the class, she always got the highest grades.
meanings.sent2: The primus rule in our family is to always be kind to others.
meanings.sent3: The primus cake at the party was so delicious that everyone wanted a second slice.
meanings.sent4: Her primus position in the company made her a role model for others to follow.
meanings.sent5: The primus star in the sky shone the brightest, guiding us through the night.

meanings.sent1: As the primus of the team, he made sure everyone worked together smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The lion was considered the primus of the pride, protecting them from danger.
meanings.sent3: The primus of the book club always picked the most interesting novels to read.
meanings.sent4: In the jungle, the primus of the monkeys was a wise old ape who kept them safe.
meanings.sent5: The primus of the orchestra directed the musicians with skill and passion.

meanings.definition: A type of stove or burner
meanings.sent1: We used a primus to cook our meals while camping in the woods.
meanings.sent2: The scout brought a primus to the campsite to boil water for tea.
meanings.sent3: The primus in the kitchen sputtered and hissed as it heated up the soup.
meanings.sent4: The old primus in the cabin gave off a comforting warmth on cold nights.
meanings.sent5: The primus glowed red as it efficiently cooked the food for the hungry hikers.

meanings.sent1: At the pub, they served a delicious primus that was a favorite among patrons.
meanings.sent2: The brewery's special primus had a unique flavor that set it apart from other beers.
meanings.sent3: The primus at the party flowed freely, making everyone merry and relaxed.
meanings.sent4: After a long day's work, he enjoyed a cold primus to unwind and relax.
meanings.sent5: The primus had a rich aroma and a smooth taste that made it a popular choice among beer enthusiasts.
